goal:
Leftfield is an independent market research agency based in London. We recruit people to attend focus groups, online forums, in-depth interviews and online studies, both in the UK and abroad.

Established in 2002, our client base includes advertisers, researchers, manufacturers, think tanks and strategic consultancies.

We operate in full accordance with the UK's Market Research Society (MRS) Code of Conduct and the Data Protection Acts 1998 and 2003. We also adhere fully to the Code on Market and Social Research as set out by the European Society for Opinion Market Research (ESOMAR).

Leftfield recruits participants and coordinates fieldwork for qualitative research projects throughout the UK, EU and globally. Our tools include EU-wide surveys, amongst national legislators, MEPs and other Brussels stakeholders.

We do not seek to influence the views of our participants in any way, rather to gather accurate and impartial data for our clients to meet their qualitative research needs. Our methods are robust and rigorous, in keeping with ESOMAR's stipulations.
interests: Banking and financial services, Business and Industry, Communication, Competition, Culture, Culture and media, Digital economy and society, Economy, finance and the euro, Education and training, Humanitarian aid and civil protection, International co-operation and development, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Research and innovation, Single market, Trade, Trans-European Networks
euInitiatives:
Leftfield is a market research field agency. As such it does not follow nor influence specific EU policies as part of its activities.

Over the last five years, Leftfield has coordinated a number of key opinion former studies, gathering insights into various issues which are part of and/or relate to the EU policy landscape, such as:

Data Protection
Telecommunications
Digital Economy
Media consumption and usage among EU policy-makers
